alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Dinwiddie; Lunenburg; Nottoway (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 12 at 6:59PM EDT until September 12 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Lunenburg County in south central Virginia... Nottoway County in south central Virginia... Northwestern Dinwiddie County in south central Virginia... Southeastern Amelia County in central Virginia... * Until 730 PM EDT. * At 659 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Nottoway, or near Blackstone, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Blackstone and Nottoway around 705 PM EDT. Fort Barfoot around 710 PM EDT. Wilsons around 715 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include North Wellville, Irby, Earls, Ammon, Murdocks, Forkland, Darvills, The Falls, Center Star, and Church Road. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
